intro: Randia habrophlebia, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the summer months. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Randia habrophlebia thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as woodlands and coastal areas.
